subject: Re: [junit] Re: Our new welcome message
msgSnippet: tinyurl s have the benefit that you are pretty much sure that no mailer will cut them off. After that, how they want to bookmark it is up to them... -- Cédric
messageBody:
tinyurl's have the benefit that you are pretty much sure that no mailer will
cut them off. After that, how they want to bookmark it is up to them...

--
Cédric



On 9/22/05, miked <mike@...> wrote:
>
> Good direction Joe, but personally I'm not a fan of the tinyurl's.
> Too tough to remember, and trying to have the browser autofill the url
> is tough that way. "Hmmm, was the faq in the a5h URL or in the
> a98....?" Easier to start with www.junit... and then have the browser
> fill in the rest
>
> However better to have it available via some resource than not at all.
> And I'd vote for a email footer reference vs a one time msg in the
> "Welcome" email where its all too easy to be overlooked (guilty as
> chg'd your honor)
>
> BTW, totally off topic - whats up with your "Recipe" book? I've had it
> on order thru Amazon for over a month and they say its still about 2
> weeks out from even shipping. I need to be learning me some junit
> stuff, and pronto!
>
> Mike
>
